heading: Tonight
text: Mostly clear, then increasing clouds west of the Green Mountains, spreading east late. Lows 0 to 10 below west and south, rising toward morning, and 5 to 15 below northeast. Winds diminishing to light and variable.

heading: Tuesday
text: Periods of morning sun giving way to clouds west to east. Snow developing in the St. Lawrence and northern NY midday, spreading into areas west of south of I-89 by late. Whiteout conditions possible late. Up to 4 inches in NY. Highs in the mid 20s to the west, near 30 east. Light winds, turning to the south and southeast 5 to 10 mph.

heading: Tuesday Night
text: Periods of snow likely north, a good chance south, with additional accumulations. Lows in the teens to around 20. Winds south to southeast near 10 mph, becoming light.
